definition: foot-binding
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample

sentences.english: Foot binding was a cosmetic practice, not much different in its own way from breast implantations or nose reconstruction.
sentences.chinese: 纏足是一種裝飾行爲，和隆胸或隆鼻殊途同歸。

sentences.english: With regard to the origin of foot binding, different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 關於纏足的起源，說法不一。

sentences.english: Even if the woman was not binding feet was not easy to show people before.
sentences.chinese: 即使後來不纏足的女人腳也不輕易展示於人前。

sentences.english: The second part analyzed the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists from the aspects of thoughts and observations.
sentences.chinese: 從思想言論方面對戊戌維新派的不纏足進行闡述。

sentences.english: At ?rst, foot-binding was the sole privilege of the high class.
sentences.chinese: 起初，纏足還只是上等人的特權。

sentences.english: Han Chinese women had their feet bound.
sentences.chinese: 在漢代，中國女性必須纏足。

sentences.english: The fifth part was a basic summary to the movement of anti-foot-binding launched by Wuxu Reformists.
sentences.chinese: 對戊戌時期維新派領導的不纏足運動的一個基本評析。

sentences.english: Sun ordered the ban to persuade foot-binding.
